content.question: In relation to a school, a student’s house is located at a distance <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>B</mi></math> away and at an angle <math alttext="theta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>θ</mi></math> from the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>-axis in the coordinate system shown in the figure. Starting from the school, the student takes a bus and travels a distance <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>A</mi></math> in the positive <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>-direction, and then gets off the bus. What is the position vector <math alttext="vector r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mover accent="true"><mi>r</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math> of the student’s house relative to where the student gets off the bus?
